sub_title: Professor at Delft University of Technology
summary: I wake up each morning with a sense that we urgently need new solutions to supply energy to meet the needs of the seven billion plus (and growing) fellow humans.  In the context of the energy transition, I am very keen to collaborate with colleagues of other disciplines including mathematicians, chemists chemists who have the magic to make new fancier molecules, geophysicists who work on similar processes but a much larger scales, geologists for their fascinating ability to make sense of complex geological formations and chemists who have the magic to make new fancier molecules. With my background in physics it is a great fulfilment to contribute to that effort by exploring new ideas, spurring scientific discoveries and developing new technologies to increase or accelerate the extraction of geo-energy resources such clean conventional and unconventional oil and gas, geothermal energy, etc. solar, wind and nuclear energy. My passion is in studying multiphase fluid flow processes in porous media and their interplay with (geo) chemical reactive processes. I have been fascinated by matter-radiation interactions since my childhood and I am an enthusiastic advocate of using X-Ray Tomography or Magnetic Resonance Imaging to probe complex flow processes in porous media.
